intro: Olearia rigida, commonly known as the rigid daisy or silverweed, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Olearia rigida thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and subalpine regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional Māori medicine.
